result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul D Tomko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence. Straight time.

miscConds.notes: $14,798.83 payable to Waukesha County.  To be paid first, before any court costs, fees and assessments.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Pay DNA surcharge during term of probation.  Pay only the mandatory court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments any other fees, costs and assessments are waived. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Packets
11/4/15 restitution notice/affidavit mailed to victim.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Defendant Paul D Tomko in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  The Court sentenced defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Corrections,straight time, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
-Restitution set at $14,798.83 payable to Waukesha County.  Any bail on deposit to be apply towards restitution.  Restitution to be paid before any Court costs, fees and assessments; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant to pay ONLY the mandatory Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments any other fees, costs and assessments are waived; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Court allows for supervision to be done in Dodge County.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Pretrial Credit sheet
Received and filed.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Paul D Tomko not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo unable to appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ADA Mineo contacted the Court indicating that he is unavailable for the currently scheduled sentencing.  Email submitted to Attorney Ertl and ADA Mineo with outline of dates available for sentencing.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant Paul D Tomko not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense researched the issue defendant brought before the Court.  Defense finds no basis for defendant's allegations.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Paul D Tomko in custody.  Joshua Drylak under the supervision of Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter here for sentencing.  Defendant reads a letter wherein he states he has already been prosecuted and is serving an illegal sentence.  Defense motion to withdraw heard and granted.  A briefing schedule to be set up upon appointment of counsel.  Defense to file a brief within 2 weeks of appointment, and state to file a response.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Paul D Tomko in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody for Francesco Mineo   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the sheriff's department pending sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Paul D Tomko not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Court Trial.  Matter re-set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant Paul D Tomko not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court REINSTATES the $2,850.00 bail and sets bail at $4,000.00 with the same previous conditions of release.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court.  Francesco Mineo unavailable to appear for the State of Wisconsin.  State does not have its file.   Matter rescheduled for Return on Warrant.  Return on warrant scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on August 22, 2014; Bench warrant in file.  Attorney VInce Guimont notified that his client was picked up on the bench warrant that was issued on August 17, 2015.    Matter scheduled for Return on Warrant in Br. 21.
REMAND to Judge.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Court ordered Bench Warrant, REMAND to Court.  Court does NOT forfeited bail, however, Court HOLDS bail until resolution of case to which bail shall be used as restitution for victims.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point/WCS Case Worker Jacob Haller.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court forfeited $150 cash bail already on deposit.  Case calendared for status conference on July 15, 2015 in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court with attorney Matt Lamke for Vincent Paul Guimont.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court to address a Justice Point Violation-positive drug test. Arguments heard. Case remains scheduled for plea on 08/17/15. Case adjourned to Branch 21.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report (Violation-positive drug test) received and filed. Attempts made to contact the parties to address violation today (6/26/15) at 1:30.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held.  Possible resolution reached.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Nathaniel Adamson for Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/26/15.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Paul D Tomko in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Paul D Tomko in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
